objective:
Try & Buy – Target paid members with CC single app(s) and photography plan who have been flagged by data science models as high propensity to upsell to CCI All Apps (note: cookie IDs and/or emails are used to enable ad targeting)

Primary Audience: Creative Climbers (younger, ambitious Creative Professionals)

Creative Climbers are passionate about creating and invested in growing in their career. They are hungry for opportunities to advance their skills and share their work. They seek new ways of working, new tools and new sources of inspiration. They are willing to pay more for powerful software if needed and may pay more for a trusted brand.

Video focus: Pr, Ae, and/or Ps subscribers who are sophisticated video pros with a high propensity for All Apps plan
overview: For conversion-focused performance media channels, we want to develop branded assets with ongoing iterations of image, animated image (GIF) and video assets to reinforce the value and key messages for Creative Cloud Individual All Apps plan. Our goals are to increase awareness for the value of All Apps (savings with 3+ apps), common project uses, and key multi-app workflows for video uses, which will drive trial or purchase of the CCI All Apps plan. Creative should reflect the insights from recent CCI All Apps messaging research and best practices we implemented in our Q3 perf. media and be visually bold, eye-catching, and showcase inspiring uses of All Apps.
title: FY23 CCI All Apps UPSELL Hok Perf. Media (NA) - Video use
campaign_name: FY23 CCI All Apps UPSELL Hok Perf. Media (NA) - Video use

overview:
This phase is the Japanese version of the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 2 has continued to evolve as a full funnel campaign to further differentiate content across the funnel. E&R content is leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals. This phase focuses around 3 new use cases/workflows; Transform, Combine Images, and Type Frame.

With this approach, we believe that if we can accomplish the following:

1) Inspire/motivate users to overcome the lack of need by showcasing how they can easily bring their creative vision to life

2) Effectively teach use-cases with a consistent set of features/workflows to overcome product complexity

3) Reduce time required to accomplish use case with aligned in product learning experiences
title: Ps Everyone Can Phase 2.0 - Engagement - JP
campaign_name: Ps Everyone Can Phase 2.0 - Engagement - JP

overview:
The French version of this full funnel, primary, content suite for the Everyone Can Photoshop campaign featuring the new Generative Fill feature. This includes a workflow and contextually relevant output to create interest among non-pro audiences. This newest phase of the Everyone Can Campaign focuses around continuing the momentum of the GA release of Generative Fill taking users through a hands on tutorial where they can experience a new way to create.

Photoshop’s brand promise to create anything you can imagine has never been more compelling, timely, and valuable. The Generative Fill feature is a huge opportunity for Photoshop and Adobe to:​

\- Deliver value to members and drive active use of the product ​

\- Empower our creative community with this technology and celebrate the amazing content that is being created​

\- Create demand for Photoshop with new audiences (pro and non-pro)​

overview:
Overview:

Korean version of the WWE full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign is leveraged and adapted from EMEA’s Travel campaign to deliver a full-funnel content suite for US. The adapted content should inspire a sense of travel and teach audiences how to capture and highlight natural beauty through simple and accessible workflows in Lightroom.

Engagement & Retention:

In FY22, about 35% of CCPP Sustained Base users were dormant and did not meet the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lr Desktop represents 15% of CCPP Desktop MAU, Lr Desktop engagement Monthly 1+ engagement performance has grown YoY in FY22 and FY23 and contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance.

Less than 1/3 of Lr Desktop users have used LrM in the past 28 days. Many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to in their plan.

With its large MAU, LrM is a proven driver for our CCPP engagement KPIs. There is an opportunity to continue driving mobile discovery and adoption for the paid desktop audience.

title: June '23 Learn Intent Anchor

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q2 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets for Try/Buy is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Acrobat's Got It - EnR - SV

To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q3 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Acrobat's Got It - EnR - UK-EMEA

**Target Audience:**

overview:
Overview:

LATAM Spanish version of the WWE full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign is leveraged and adapted from EMEA’s Travel campaign to deliver a full-funnel content suite for US. The adapted content should inspire a sense of travel and teach audiences how to capture and highlight natural beauty through simple and accessible workflows in Lightroom.

Engagement & Retention:

In FY22, about 35% of CCPP Sustained Base users were dormant and did not meet the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lr Desktop represents 15% of CCPP Desktop MAU, Lr Desktop engagement Monthly 1+ engagement performance has grown YoY in FY22 and FY23 and contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance.

Less than 1/3 of Lr Desktop users have used LrM in the past 28 days. Many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to in their plan.

With its large MAU, LrM is a proven driver for our CCPP engagement KPIs. There is an opportunity to continue driving mobile discovery and adoption for the paid desktop audience.
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Travel - ES-LA
campaign_name: Your Shot, Your Story - Travel - ES-LA

overview:
This is an extension of the Learn. Grow. Let's Go. campaign.

We want to drive usage of Adobe Express from CC Express entitled members by building awareness of Express as added value they are entitled to as part of their paid membership. Leveraging one of our existing Membership Value campaign constructs, Learn. Grow. Let’s Go, we’d like to highlight relevant use cases and benefits of how Express is a companion app to customers’ flagship app use to meet their lightweight needs.

Phase 2 highlights experiences from 3 creatives, with 2 being members of the Adobe Express Ambassador program. In addition to the campaign videos, creators will create a UGC version of the story and workflow to share on their own channels and lead a session on Adobe Live. The Discover page will be populated by a curated playlist of c-pro Adobe Express content relevant across Design, Video, and Photo, applicable to both pre- and post-Project X.

overview:
The LATAM Spanish version of this phase is the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 1 focused on versioning acquisition content for E&R to ensure a quick full funnel delivery. Phase 1.5 will be tailored to the E&R experience. This includes leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals.

With this approach, we believe that if we can accomplish the following:

1) Inspire/motivate users to overcome the lack of need by showcasing how they can easily bring their creative vision to life

2) Effectively teach use-cases with a consistent set of features/workflows to overcome product complexity

3) Reduce time required to accomplish use case with aligned in product learning experiences
title: Ps Everyone Can Phase 1.5 - Engagement - ES-LA
campaign_name: Ps Everyone Can Phase 1.5 - Engagement - ES-LA

The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets for Try/Buy is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.

objective:
**Target Audience:**

- Photo hobbyist prospects and beginner/inactive Lr users
overview:
Overview:

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign is leveraged and adapted from EMEA’s Travel campaign to deliver a full-funnel content suite for US. The adapted content should inspire a sense of travel and teach audiences how to capture and highlight natural beauty through simple and accessible workflows in Lightroom.

Engagement & Retention:

In FY22, about 35% of CCPP Sustained Base users were dormant and did not meet the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lr Desktop represents 15% of CCPP Desktop MAU, Lr Desktop engagement Monthly 1+ engagement performance has grown YoY in FY22 and FY23 and contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance.

Less than 1/3 of Lr Desktop users have used LrM in the past 28 days. Many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to in their plan.

With its large MAU, LrM is a proven driver for our CCPP engagement KPIs. There is an opportunity to continue driving mobile discovery and adoption for the paid desktop audience.

Below is the hero video for the campaign that will be featured on the main landing page:

#### Campaign Hero Video

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment

overview: Assets tied to the 8/16/23 GA launch of Adobe Express
title: Adobe Express GA Launch Q323

objective:
Home & Personal: Working Parents, Learning and Working Adults

**Barriers Toward Filing:**

- Negative feelings toward filing taxes – Dread, overwhelm, frustration
- Time Management – fearful of how much time it would take
- Organization – Required tax documents may be in multiple places
- Initiating the task – Not knowing where to start

**Barriers Toward Adobe Acrobat:**

- Preference to maintaining status quo processes due to familiarity
- May not be thinking of Acrobat as a tool to help them get ready for their taxes
- May know some, but not all, of the tools that could help them
- May think it will take too long to learn how to use a new tool

**Messaging Opportunity:**

Show how subscribers can get the most out of the tools they already have to improve their tax prep experiences

**Positioning:**

Adobe Acrobat takes the hassle out of tax prep
overview:
Goal: Leverage tax season and the tax prep challenges that come along with it to make Acrobat top of mind.

Media Strategy: Promote across Adobe owned and existing performance media channels

Main Message: Make tax prep as easy as 1, 2, 3 with Adobe Acrobat.

Supporting Messages:

Scan and Browser Extensions: Easily digitize and access tax documents – paper and digital – in one place with free PDF tools inside Adobe Scan and Acrobat for Chrome/Edge

Combine and Organize: Effortlessly organize your tax documents into one neat file with Combine and Organize tools inside Acrobat Pro DC.

Protect and Share: Confidently Protect and Share your tax documents with Protect and Share tools inside Acrobat Pro DC.

Campaign Timing: Beginning week of Aug 14, 2023 -- Tax deadline

Tactics: Display, Social, Email

Localized test in Engagement and Retention; Regional adaptation of US assets for DE tax season

• Helpfulness Through Guidance/Support/Partnership

• Getting prepped for taxes is quicker and easier than you think

• Cohort: Engagement and Retention to capitalize on familiarity and usage entry barriers
title: FY23Q3 - EnR - Tax - DE

overview:
This phase is the German version of the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 2 has continued to evolve as a full funnel campaign to further differentiate content across the funnel. E&R content is leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals. This phase focuses around 3 new use cases/workflows; Transform, Combine Images, and Type Frame.

With this approach, we believe that if we can accomplish the following:

1) Inspire/motivate users to overcome the lack of need by showcasing how they can easily bring their creative vision to life

2) Effectively teach use-cases with a consistent set of features/workflows to overcome product complexity

3) Reduce time required to accomplish use case with aligned in product learning experiences

  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q3 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment

overview:
The French version of this phase is the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 1 focused on versioning acquisition content for E&R to ensure a quick full funnel delivery. Phase 1.5 will be tailored to the E&R experience. This includes leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals.

With this approach, we believe that if we can accomplish the following:

1) Inspire/motivate users to overcome the lack of need by showcasing how they can easily bring their creative vision to life

2) Effectively teach use-cases with a consistent set of features/workflows to overcome product complexity

3) Reduce time required to accomplish use case with aligned in product learning experiences

overview:
Scope:

Only for the mobile version of the article - https://creativecloud.adobe.com/discover/article/up-your-tiktok-game-with-jillian-nicole-smith

All users visiting on mobile.

Deeplink to be added to the share link HVA: https://premierepro.app.link/I1e0AFoQtob

Hypothesis:

Providing Desktop based deeplinks to users will be far more effective than directing them to 'Copy to Files' workflows.

Deeplink example. The user doesn't have the need to go back to the Discover article as the deeplink opens up the article content along with free asset in-app.

Because

Copy to Files is not easy to follow for users. Dead ends if the user doesn't understand.

Users needs to be signed-in to perform the action.

Hardly any way for us to measure if the user actually got back to open/use the file.

Not in scope:

Add Library workflows

Lightroom presets deeplinks

Release Plan:

We will release this as an A/B test. Details on the Requirements tab.

Success metrics:

Primary - Product engagement (% of cohort users who end up on premiere pro in the next 24 hrs)

Secondary - article engagement on mobile.

Campaign routes:

Social

Display ads

As we target the mobile users specifically.

objective:
People are naturally reflective at the end of the year and want to be set up to enter the coming year in the best possible way.

One of the ways to bring closure to the year is to digitize, organize and store important documents, that way they can filed and accessed in ways that work for them

Acrobat provides the organizational tools needed for everyone’s unique storage methods

Acrobat is everywhere so people can store and access all of their important information all in one place from any device
overview:
Objective: Drive Acrobat and Adobe Scan discoverability and usage amongst customers (Pro).

Strategy: Connect with prospects and existing users by showcasing how helpful Acrobat can be in supporting the end-of-year propensity to get digitally organized and to be ready for the year to come

Key Message: Organize your life, your way, through Adobe Acrobat Pro & Adobe Scan

Scan: With Adobe Scan mobile app, turn important paper into PDFs so you can easily find and access from anywhere.

Browser Exts: Work with PDFs right in your browser with the Acrobat extensions for Chrome and Edge. Also save important docs into Adobe’s cloud storage directly from your browser so they’re all in one place.

Connect 3rd Party Storage: Stop jumping from app to app to find important documents – find it all in Acrobat – across web, desktop or mobile – by connecting to your 3rd party storage partners so it's all in one place.

overview:
Latin American Spanish version of US YSYS Pet Photography. YSYS Pets is a campaign that will run in EMEA in Q2 for the Acquisition audience.

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Pet Photography. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos of their pets and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 35% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and not meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and current users to try Lightroom through approachable content about Pet photography

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills (Minimum Use).

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with another surface and the product more (Depth of Use).

While this campaign has been leveraged from EMEA and leans very pro, the objective is to minimize the amount of intimidating equipment (SLRs, big lenses, lighting equipment) to make this accessible to everyone, regardless of skill level.

overview:
Overview:

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: photography technique utilizing light. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos that showcase the light of the subject matter and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement and Retention:

On average, 36% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and do not meet the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the “recommended for photo editing” product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey. Lightroom Desktop KPI performance is a critical component of our New User KPI performance.

About 30% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

As of Q2 2022, Both Lightroom Desktop and Mobile engagement for Monthly 1+ has exceeded YoY performance consistently every week – major product updates (June release, MAX) and tentpole campaigns like YSYS are critical to the continued strength and performance of Lr engagement for the sustained base.

objective:
Home & Personal: Working Parents, Learning and Working Adults

**Barriers Toward Filing:**

- Negative feelings toward filing taxes – Dread, overwhelm, frustration
- Time Management – fearful of how much time it would take
- Organization – Required tax documents may be in multiple places
- Initiating the task – Not knowing where to start

**Barriers Toward Adobe Acrobat:**

- Preference to maintaining status quo processes due to familiarity
- May not be thinking of Acrobat as a tool to help them get ready for their taxes
- May know some, but not all, of the tools that could help them
- May think it will take too long to learn how to use a new tool

**Messaging Opportunity:**

Show how subscribers can get the most out of the tools they already have to improve their tax prep experiences

**Positioning:**

Adobe Acrobat takes the hassle out of tax prep
overview:
Goal: Leverage tax season and the tax prep challenges that come along with it to make Acrobat top of mind.

Media Strategy: Promote across Adobe owned and existing performance media channels

Main Message: Make tax prep as easy as 1, 2, 3 with Adobe Acrobat.

Supporting Messages:

Scan & Browser Extensions: Easily digitize and access tax documents – paper and digital – in one place with free PDF tools inside Adobe Scan and Acrobat for Chrome/Edge

Combine & Organize: Effortlessly organize your tax documents into one neat file with Combine and Organize tools inside Acrobat Pro DC.

Protect & Share: Confidently Protect and Share your tax documents with Protect and Share tools inside Acrobat Pro DC.

Campaign Timing: Even Approach January - April

Tactics: Display, Social, Email, Youtube Tutorials, A.com Landing Pages + SEO, Paid Search, ACDC, Modal Cards, Affiliates, PR/Comms

Test in E&R

Create a phased messaging approach to better connect with procrastinators (Mid-March - End of Tax Season)

Speak more relevantly to their mindset/situation and position Adobe as the go-to resource for tax prep to get the job done

• Test Positioning: Helpfulness Through Guidance/Support/Partnership

• Test Messaging: Getting prepped for taxes is quicker and easier than you think

Testing Approach:

• Cohort: E&R to capitalize on familiarity and usage entry barriers

• A/B Test in Email (3+4), Display & A.com Landing Pages

Timing: March 13 – Tax Deadline
title: FY23 Tax

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment

objective:
**Overall:**

- There’s strong awareness of Adobe Acrobat but limited knowledge of the capabilities beyond viewing PDFs
- E-signature features in Acrobat have even less awareness (than PDF features) with these micro-SMBs
- Blue collar & white collar, service-based businesses age 25 – 54 (examples: lawyers, accountants, architects, contractors, consultants, and real estate agents) who’ve worked hard to either build their own business or in their role at a small business (<100 employees).
- Wearing many hats, they are often time, resource, and budget constrained. Being able to get things done easily and eﬀiciently is important.
- They need document solutions for their business and are willing to pay for tools; especially if it gives them more time back to focus on their business. But many have developed their own patchwork systems, and while inefficient, inertia is a barrier to change.
- 52% say improving productivity and efficiency is their greatest challenge in the next 12 months
- 39% say managing data and document files is a top business need

**Acquisition Audiences:**

- Prospective paying customers- it’s possible they are already using the free product but it doesn’t have all the premium features they would need for their business
- Micro-entrepreneurs (1-9 employees), working professionals working at a small company (less than 100 employees), freelancers

**How to Reach the Acquisition Audience:**

- Message/show how an Acrobat tool can help for any practically document/business challenge

**What we want the Acquisition Audience to Feel:**

- Relieved that Acrobat saves them time, and simplifies their workflows
- “oh wait, I can do that with Acrobat?!”
- We want audiences to see the value in purchasing the subscription by offering a free 7-day trial
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q2 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets for Try/Buy is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Acrobat's Got It - Acq - US

overview:
This phase is the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 1 focused on versioning acquisition content for E&R to ensure a quick full funnel delivery. Phase 1.5 will be tailored to the E&R experience. This includes leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals.

With this approach, we believe that if we can accomplish the following:

1) Inspire/motivate users to overcome the lack of need by showcasing how they can easily bring their creative vision to life

2) Effectively teach use-cases with a consistent set of features/workflows to overcome product complexity

3) Reduce time required to accomplish use case with aligned in product learning experiences

overview:
Brazilian Portuguese version of US YSYS Pet Photography. YSYS Pets is a campaign that will run in EMEA in Q2 for the Acquisition audience.

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Pet Photography. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos of their pets and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 35% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and not meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and current users to try Lightroom through approachable content about Pet photography

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills (Minimum Use).

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with another surface and the product more (Depth of Use).

While this campaign has been leveraged from EMEA and leans very pro, the objective is to minimize the amount of intimidating equipment (SLRs, big lenses, lighting equipment) to make this accessible to everyone, regardless of skill level.
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Pets - BR

objective:
Creative Professionals who use Ps, Ai, Id design apps (priority #1 to target Creative Professionals)

- Work on a regular basis with clients and stakeholders and need to provide their work-in-progress work / drafts for feedback and go through multiple revision cycles. These creative professionals need to share creative work and get feedback and approvals from clients and/or internal stakeholders.
- Work titles and environment:

- Graphic Designers, Brand designers, Photographers, & Video Creators, Small creative Agencies (Individual licenses)
- In-house creative teams (Team and ENT licenses)

While working on their design projects, creative professionals share their work differently with different partners:

- They share a live document with their team members and partners to get quick edits and feedback (Invite to Edit)

They share specific versions of the document with their clients, stakeholders during the reviewing and revision process

Sharing for feedback and proofing has been a major pain point for creative professionals.

Collecting feedback is killing time and creative flow ( [Forrester report](https://www.adobe.com/content/dam/cc/us/en/creativecloud/collaboration/Adobe_Creative_Cloud_Collaboration_Forrester.pdf) \+ [internal Creatives’ Workflow Research](https://adobegoldmine.com/pdfviewer.php?docid=AZ20220408000000020&datasource=ADBASAP&trans=view&caller=resultslist)). The process is fragmented, multiple communication tools are used with different stakeholders and the feedback is messy because it’s not centralized.

Overview:

The Japanese version of this full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: photography technique utilizing light. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos that showcase the light of the subject matter and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement and Retention:

On average, 36% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and do not meet the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the “recommended for photo editing” product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey. Lightroom Desktop KPI performance is a critical component of our New User KPI performance.

About 30% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

As of Q2 2022, Both Lightroom Desktop and Mobile engagement for Monthly 1+ has exceeded YoY performance consistently every week – major product updates (June release, MAX) and tentpole campaigns like YSYS are critical to the continued strength and performance of Lr engagement for the sustained base.

title: March Value Intent Anchor

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q2 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets for Try/Buy is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Acrobat's Got It - EnR - US

overview:
Context: CTR numbers for Happy Kelli Display seemed very low going into month 3 with a supposed CTR of 0.04% in ECP. However, when validating the data this seems to be incorrect. The back-end data is showing the CTR as 0.09% which is exceeding our benchmark of 0.05%. To validate what we're seeing, we'd like to test running Happy Kelly Display going into its 4th month versus creative that hasn't been shown in a while.

Goal: Learn if creative fatigue has kicked in to determine how long we should run display campaigns that are performing well.

What else would we like to learn?

\- How does longer-running content perform against content we haven't shown in a while from a CTR perspective?

\- How doe CPSAU efficiency compare to an existing campaign versus running a newer campaign leveraging past content?
title: Pr CPSAU Creative Fatigue A/B Test
campaign_name: Pr CPSAU Creative Fatigue A/B Test

overview:
Paid social test.

The Problem: Ps Everyone Can Paid Social Campaign for new users CTR is performing 50% below the onboarding Q3 campaign baseline (0.94%).

Hypothesis​: We think the Everyone creative verbiage comes off as too technical for new user's and the creative doesn't properly show what use-cases the user can accomplish. ​If we make the verbiage more friendly to new users and choose imagery showing user's what they can accomplish, we should see an increase in engagement/CTR.

Test:

Variant A: Original

Variant B: Same copy different image

Variant C: different copy & same image

Variant D: different copy & different image
title: Ps: Everyone Can - Onboarding Test

overview:
Japanese version of US YSYS Pet Photography. YSYS Pets is a campaign that will run in EMEA in Q2 for the Acquisition audience.

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Pet Photography. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos of their pets and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 35% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and not meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and current users to try Lightroom through approachable content about Pet photography

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills (Minimum Use).

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with another surface and the product more (Depth of Use).

While this campaign has been leveraged from EMEA and leans very pro, the objective is to minimize the amount of intimidating equipment (SLRs, big lenses, lighting equipment) to make this accessible to everyone, regardless of skill level.
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Pets - JP
campaign_name: Your Shot, Your Story - Pets - JP

objective:
Paid Members of Creative Cloud across all individual plan offerings. Professionals, Communicators & Consumers. They do however have common denominators that this campaign is built upon:

5/10 members currently perceive the value of their membership to be lower than the price.

Price is the #1 attrition reason.

Members trust peers first, influencers second and brands third.

To increase value perception (and price elasticity) we have identified 3 value pillars that research show can increase value perception and willingness to retain – Learn & Guidance is the first and most important of those pillars. Members who associate Adobe with Learn & Guidance have a 20pp higher willingness to retain vs. the average members and are more active users. The challenge we are here to solve is that only 11% of our members make the association between Adobe & Learn. We need to increase awareness of our learn offering, and with that drive active use among members.

Learn & Guidance includes tutorials, live sessions, training courses, contextual help as well as building domain knowledge.

The primary message is: Adobe offers multiple types of learn so that you can choose to learn when you want, what you want and on what device and platform you want.

1-min Videos.

objective:
Target Audience:

- Consumers​
- 60/40 Male/Female​
- Age range: 11-70 years old​
- Most are beginners​
- Driven by their passion for photography​
- Attracted to the creative control Lightroom and Photoshop provides them​
- Trust our products and value Adobe heritage

The campaign will have an empowering approach to motivate this audience to improve their photos. The creative will show easy-to-use features and uncomplicated steps to achieve results.​

Here’s how the three barriers will be addressed:​

**Motivation:** The voiceover/copyencourages users to try it. Tone of campaign also acknowledges that we know they’re not using the app. ​

**Time:** Animation, voiceover, and real-time use of features will show users how fast they can improve their imagesin a few clicks. ​

**Confidence:**  The actions will make it fun and motivating to give them the confidence that they need to open their app and try it.  The features selected are easy to use and aligned to top use cases for broad appeal.​

Note: Tap. Tap. Ta-da!​ is the internal campaign name.  It will not be used in external creative assets/channels.  ​
overview:
The Tap. Tap. Ta-da! campaign's purpose is to lift members from inactive to active status. 80% of our members express a desire to become more active, but current resurrection marketing strategy and tactics only resurrects approximately 25% of the members each quarter. The focus of this campaign is on the photography audience as it is the largest group - making up nearly 50% of the total audience size.

The goal of the campaign will be to increase the number of members lifted from inactive to active. Moving a member from Inactive (0 or 1 day of activity in the last 28 days) to Active (2+ days of activity in the last 28 days) decreases cancel attempts by 4% and every member that we can move from inactive to active is worth $10 in ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue).
title: Tap. Tap. Ta-da! Campaign

overview:
Ashley Fouyolle is a multidisciplinary designer who started a company called UNWRP in her Brooklyn apartment. She uses Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign in cross-app workflows to create luxury gift wrap in unique patterns and vibrant colors. ​

Design use case display and paid social ads (static and video ads for FB, IG, YT)
For conversion-focused performance media channels, we want to develop branded assets with ongoing iterations of image, animated image (GIF) and video assets to reinforce the value and key messages for Creative Cloud Individual All Apps plan in Q4 2022. Our goals are to increase awareness for the value of All Apps (savings with 3+ apps), common project uses, and key multi-app workflows for design and video uses, driving trial or purchase of the CCI All Apps plan. Creative should reflect the insights from recent CCI All Apps Upsell messaging research.

All Apps Upsell messaging options for Design uses (leveraging recent Material CCI All Apps message research insights):

\- 20+ apps in one subscription for Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat, and more.

\- Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps, designed to grow all types of creativity and skill levels

objective:
Target Audience:

- Consumers​
- 60/40 Male/Female​
- Age range: 11-70 years old​
- Most are beginners​
- Driven by their passion for photography​
- Attracted to the creative control Lightroom and Photoshop provides them​
- Trust our products and value Adobe heritage

The campaign will have an empowering approach to motivate this audience to improve their photos. The creative will show easy-to-use features and uncomplicated steps to achieve results.​

Here’s how the three barriers will be addressed:​

**Motivation:** The voiceover/copyencourages users to try it. Tone of campaign also acknowledges that we know they’re not using the app. ​

**Time:** Animation, voiceover, and real-time use of features will show users how fast they can improve their imagesin a few clicks. ​

**Confidence:**  The actions will make it fun and motivating to give them the confidence that they need to open their app and try it.  The features selected are easy to use and aligned to top use cases for broad appeal.​

Note: Tap. Tap. Ta-da!​ is the internal campaign name.  It will not be used in external creative assets/channels.  ​
overview:
Brazilian Portuguese version of the Tap. Tap. Ta-da! campaign. The campaign's purpose is to lift members from inactive to active status. 80% of our members express a desire to become more active, but current resurrection marketing strategy and tactics only resurrects approximately 25% of the members each quarter. The focus of this campaign is on the photography audience as it is the largest group - making up nearly 50% of the total audience size.

The goal of the campaign will be to increase the number of members lifted from inactive to active. Moving a member from Inactive (0 or 1 day of activity in the last 28 days) to Active (2+ days of activity in the last 28 days) decreases cancel attempts by 4% and every member that we can move from inactive to active is worth $10 in ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue).
title: Tap. Tap. Ta-da! Campaign - BR

overview: Drive active use by providing free images and templates related to brochures.
title: Brochures

objective:
Target Audience:

Photo hobbyist prospects and beginner/inactive Lr users

**Audience Insights:**

- Campaign focus is on marketing self-portraits for the beginner. The creative and messaging in the campaign need to help our users overcome key barriers for prospects and customers:

- Perception that Lightroom is for professional photographers
- Lack of confidence
- Lack of time & motivation

- Creative and messaging to overcome the key barriers could revolve around the following:

- Featuring talent and equipment that feels approachable to users.
- Showcasing smart/hidden product features / workflows that help overcome time and skill constraints.
- Highlight intuitive workflows that meet users where they are so they can be successful

**Feedback from users:**

- Feedback from beginner prospects:

- Content conveys that you can make “artistic”, “high quality” and “professional edits” (top mentions)
- Nearly all prospects interviewed felt the intent for the ad and product is for professional photographers.
- Elements that led to professional perception:

- Presence of DSLR/mirrorless cameras
- Survey participants reported mainly using smartphone to capture
- Color grading feature looks advanced/technical
- Adobe brand perception

- Feedback from new Lightroom users:

- _“For a mom user, it’s a little over functional. The permutations of choices across the bottom and then the choice under each one… are too many.” -Shahana_
- _“This is definitely a heavy technical app. It’s not like a laymen photo editing app compared to other things I use.” – Anna_
- _“It’s hard to get the expectation you have in your head to your computer…learning lightroom or photography in general…so many settings…one little change can make it completely diﬀerent…how each little thing can interact with every other thing is challenging…I like to think I am a smart person…it is a little bit harder than I expected it to be…” – Danielle_
overview:
Japanese localized version of YSYS Self-Portrait.

Overview:

Drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Self Portrait / Selfies. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more self-portraits and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows

Business/Marketing Context:

Acquisition:

Traffic soft in Q1 but trended up later in quarter, driven by natural (-39% YoY, -7% QoQ) and paid search (-16% YoY, -2% QoQ) declines.

YSYS Campaign is making up for decline in organic traffic with sustained quarterly investment in Display, Video and Social paid media.

Customer feedback on YSYS marketing assets and campaign landing page: Lightroom can produce artistic and high quality photos, but perception is that it is for professional photographers. This perception is driven by the equipment and workflows we have showcased in past content. Full research deck here.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 49% of CCPP users in the sustained base are not engaging and meeting the Monthly 2+ Days KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP Monthly 2+ Days KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Lightroom Mobile is the most used mobile app in CCPP and is critical to our Mobile 1+ KPI performance, contributing an average of 79% of Mobile MAU for this KPI

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and users to try Lightroom through approachable content about self-portraits and selfies.

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for CCPP Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with the product more

Note: Engagement KPIs are being updated on Q2 2022 – all KPIs are now inclusive of entire ecosystem: desktop, mobile and web

Target Audience:

Photo hobbyist prospects and beginner/inactive Lr users
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Self-Portrait - JP

overview:
Users are not discovering, launching, and submitting Remixes because they are unaware the feature exists within the Discover Panel in Lightroom.

By running a cohesive campaign alongside social and marketing that illustrates the value of Remix while also providing simple/deep linking navigation to this feature, we will see an increase in awareness and usage which will give a lift in Remix Submissions and increase in engagement among sustained premium users.

The user will be exposed to Remixing material that illustrated its value on multiple surfaces throughout the campaign. This material will have a simple deep linking capability so that the user can easily navigate to the Remixing Tab within the Discover Panel. This intuitive navigation is key to the users' engagement as we have seen that discoverability has been an issue based on the data provided. With each exposure, the user is more likely to try Remix. Once a user has successfully navigated to Remix, we will no longer show them campaign materials.
title: Lr Remix Promotion

objective:
Paid Members of Creative Cloud across all individual plan offerings. Professionals, Communicators & Consumers. They do however have common denominators that this campaign is built upon:

5/10 members currently perceive the value of their membership to be lower than the price.

Price is the #1 attrition reason.

Members trust peers first, influencers second and brands third.

To increase value perception (and price elasticity) we have identified 3 value pillars that research show can increase value perception and willingness to retain – Learn & Guidance is the first and most important of those pillars. Members who associate Adobe with Learn & Guidance have a 20pp higher willingness to retain vs. the average members and are more active users. The challenge we are here to solve is that only 11% of our members make the association between Adobe & Learn. We need to increase awareness of our learn offering, and with that drive active use among members.

Learn & Guidance includes tutorials, live sessions, training courses, contextual help as well as building domain knowledge.
overview:
In this campaign we will communicate the full breadth of Adobes learn offering, and what those learn resources can do to set our members up for success. The primary message is: Adobe offers multiple types of learn so that you can choose to learn when you want, what you want and on what device and platform you want.

Proof Points:

1-min Videos.

Full training courses from Learn team

Adobe Live

Domain Knowledge (E.g Flagship App Campaigns, Trend reports)

In App Learn (Ps, Lr, Pr)
title: Learn. Grow. Let's Go. - APAC

objective:
- For this test, we’re going to place content into the Ps Evergreen 2+ and Ps Sustain tracks. Can you share the audience criteria and estimated traffic?
- Checked with our paid media team, and they said that we’ve matched approximately 200k users in Photoshop resurrect, and 750k 2+ users.
- Our CTR for evergreen ranges 0.11%. So we’re looking at traffic generated from this source ~1-2k. If we send this in an email program we’re looking at a 1% click rate on about 250k distro list for Photoshop Design.
- All in all, if we used Email + Paid Media without splitting traffic for test this would be around 5k traffic to the discover pages.
overview:
This campaign to deliver Aha moment to Photoshop user through a series of "Make it in minute" videos that leverage the In-App Discover panel. From the discover page tutorials will be hosted in app with a deeplink to open assets.

Objective: Leverage Discover content in CCH to drive CC app engagement via a deeplink to Discover Panel with a free asset in Photoshop.

Business Problem: Users often are inspired and empowered through helpful CCH Discover content yet they currently view the content in a web browser, instead of in product where deeper learning and engagement is possible.

User Problem: CCH Discover content has related sample files that takes multiple steps to configure, and viewing the instructions requires split focus between Photoshop's workspace and CCH on web.

Hypothesis: Seamlessly driving users from CCH Discover content to Discover Panel with auto-loaded sample files will accelerate ah-ha moments for users and increase avg monthly active days.
title: Ps - Make It In A Minute -Discover Tests
campaign_name: Ps - Make It In A Minute -Discover Tests

objective:
Target Audience:

Photo hobbyist prospects and beginner/inactive Lr users

**Audience Insights:**

- Campaign focus is on marketing self-portraits for the beginner. The creative and messaging in the campaign need to help our users overcome key barriers for prospects and customers:

- Perception that Lightroom is for professional photographers
- Lack of confidence
- Lack of time & motivation

- Creative and messaging to overcome the key barriers could revolve around the following:

- Featuring talent and equipment that feels approachable to users.
- Showcasing smart/hidden product features / workflows that help overcome time and skill constraints.
- Highlight intuitive workflows that meet users where they are so they can be successful

**Feedback from users:**

- Feedback from beginner prospects:

- Content conveys that you can make “artistic”, “high quality” and “professional edits” (top mentions)
- Nearly all prospects interviewed felt the intent for the ad and product is for professional photographers.
- Elements that led to professional perception:

- Presence of DSLR/mirrorless cameras
- Survey participants reported mainly using smartphone to capture
- Color grading feature looks advanced/technical
- Adobe brand perception

- Feedback from new Lightroom users:

- _“For a mom user, it’s a little over functional. The permutations of choices across the bottom and then the choice under each one… are too many.” -Shahana_
- _“This is definitely a heavy technical app. It’s not like a laymen photo editing app compared to other things I use.” – Anna_
- _“It’s hard to get the expectation you have in your head to your computer…learning lightroom or photography in general…so many settings…one little change can make it completely diﬀerent…how each little thing can interact with every other thing is challenging…I like to think I am a smart person…it is a little bit harder than I expected it to be…” – Danielle_

Overview:

Drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Self Portrait / Selfies. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more self-portraits and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows

Business/Marketing Context:

Acquisition:

Traffic soft in Q1 but trended up later in quarter, driven by natural (-39% YoY, -7% QoQ) and paid search (-16% YoY, -2% QoQ) declines.

YSYS Campaign is making up for decline in organic traffic with sustained quarterly investment in Display, Video and Social paid media.

Customer feedback on YSYS marketing assets and campaign landing page: Lightroom can produce artistic and high quality photos, but perception is that it is for professional photographers. This perception is driven by the equipment and workflows we have showcased in past content. Full research deck here.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 49% of CCPP users in the sustained base are not engaging and meeting the Monthly 2+ Days KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP Monthly 2+ Days KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Lightroom Mobile is the most used mobile app in CCPP and is critical to our Mobile 1+ KPI performance, contributing an average of 79% of Mobile MAU for this KPI

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and users to try Lightroom through approachable content about self-portraits and selfies.

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for CCPP Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with the product more

Note: Engagement KPIs are being updated on Q2 2022 – all KPIs are now inclusive of entire ecosystem: desktop, mobile and web

Target Audience:

Photo hobbyist prospects and beginner/inactive Lr users
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Self-Portrait - ES-LA
campaign_name: Your Shot, Your Story - Self-Portrait - ES-LA
