objective:
Target Audience:

- Consumers​
- 60/40 Male/Female​
- Age range: 11-70 years old​
- Most are beginners​
- Driven by their passion for photography​
- Attracted to the creative control Lightroom and Photoshop provides them​
- Trust our products and value Adobe heritage

The campaign will have an empowering approach to motivate this audience to improve their photos. The creative will show easy-to-use features and uncomplicated steps to achieve results.​

Here’s how the three barriers will be addressed:​

**Motivation:** The voiceover/copyencourages users to try it. Tone of campaign also acknowledges that we know they’re not using the app. ​

**Time:** Animation, voiceover, and real-time use of features will show users how fast they can improve their imagesin a few clicks. ​

**Confidence:**  The actions will make it fun and motivating to give them the confidence that they need to open their app and try it.  The features selected are easy to use and aligned to top use cases for broad appeal.​

Note: Tap. Tap. Ta-da!​ is the internal campaign name.  It will not be used in external creative assets/channels.  ​
overview:
Korean version of the Tap. Tap. Ta-da! campaign. The campaign's purpose is to lift members from inactive to active status. 80% of our members express a desire to become more active, but current resurrection marketing strategy and tactics only resurrects approximately 25% of the members each quarter. The focus of this campaign is on the photography audience as it is the largest group - making up nearly 50% of the total audience size.

The goal of the campaign will be to increase the number of members lifted from inactive to active. Moving a member from Inactive (0 or 1 day of activity in the last 28 days) to Active (2+ days of activity in the last 28 days) decreases cancel attempts by 4% and every member that we can move from inactive to active is worth $10 in ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue).
title: Tap. Tap. Ta-da! Campaign - KR

overview:
Overview:

This is a full-funnel campaign that will drive trial, purchase and repeat use of our photography products by building out inspirational and educational content for prospects and customers.

This campaign will focus on a new use case: Pet Photography. The goal is to inspire prospects and users to take more photos of their pets and learn how to edit with simple and accessible workflows.

Engagement & Retention:

On average, 35% of CCPP users in the sustained base are dormant and not meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Within the Lightroom Desktop sustained base audience, only 12.5% of users are meeting the Monthly 1+ KPI. Drivers of low engagement are 1) lack of need, 2) too hard to use, and 3) lack of time.

Although Lightroom Desktop represents 15% of CCPP MAU, it contributes a larger percentage to the overall CCPP KPI performance and is the recommended product we encourage new users to download in the App Picker during the New User Journey

Only 39.2% of Lightroom Desktop users have used Lightroom Mobile in the past 28 days, many paid users are unaware of the mobile apps they are entitled to.

Objective & KPI:

Objective: Inspire prospects and current users to try Lightroom through approachable content about Pet photography

Primary KPI: Drive Monthly 1+ Use for Lr Desktop and Lr Mobile users by teaching the basic foundations of photography for a beginner with limited skills (Minimum Use).

Secondary KPI: Drive Monthly Average Use for Lr Desktop/Lr Mobile Users by encouraging the user to engage with another surface and the product more (Depth of Use).

While this campaign has been leveraged from EMEA and leans very pro, the objective is to minimize the amount of intimidating equipment (SLRs, big lenses, lighting equipment) to make this accessible to everyone, regardless of skill level.
title: Your Shot, Your Story - Pets

objective:
Adobe has 16M paid customers across the Design, Video, Illustration, Photography and Student audience segments across the globe. Within each of these audiences there is an interest and proficiency spectrum ranging from beginners to experts and Hobbyist to Professionals. Their motivation to create range from strictly internal to personal validation to driving policy change and public opinion. Some of these members have paid for their membership themselves, others have access through work. Some are new as members; others have been members for 10 years. All in all – it is a diverse group.

The good news – research performed by Bond Loyalty Group in 2020, shows that regardless of how you slice and dice the audience matrix, the same Top 3 value perception drivers win.

**Drivers of Value Perception**

**#1 Learn & Guidance**

Our members want to learn – they seek both domain knowledge and product knowledge to get better at their current craft or learn new skills. Adobe has a breadth of learn resources for them – online seminars, learn courses, quick how-to videos, domain expertise shared by the community and guided tutorials in app.  The challenge/opportunity – only 11% of our members associate Adobe with Learn. But those who do have a 20 percentage points higher willingness to retain and 77% say that they are likely or highly likely to use our learn resources once they are made aware.

**#2 Productivity & Flexibility**

This pillar is about having the flexibility to work anywhere, on any device as well as removing repetitive tasks and leverage templates to get to the end results quicker. 43% of our members currently associate Adobe with efficiency and those who do, have a 13 percentage point higher willingness to renew their membership. Adobe offers the ability to work seamlessly across platforms, branch out to new apps, AI powered workflows that reduces the time spent on repetitive tasks and of course productivity services like CC Libraries and Collaboration. We also provide templates that help kickstart a creative process for beginners or members in a rush.

**\# 3 Member Exclusives**

This pillar is about being rewarded for your loyalty and the total financial value included in the membership. We offer our members several benefits that outside of the membership would come at an additional cost – among them a comprehensive fonts collection and Adobe Portfolio. We also provide free presets from sought after photographers as well as free Photoshop and Illustrator templates.

25% of the respondents in the research use at least one competing service/benefit instead of leveraging the equivalent from Adobe that is included in their membership. 72% of those who do, pay for that service, and learn is the #1 contributor.

In May, Adobe launched a campaign focused on the first value pillar – Learn & Guidance. We are now asking agency XX to create a campaign for Pillar #3 – Member Exclusives.

Member exclusives can be split in 2 subcategories – Benefits that you get because you are a member & Benefits that you can ONLY get from Adobe.

**Benefits that are exclusive to members only.**

Within the creative cloud membership, there are several benefits that members likely would pay for outside of their membership if they were not included – **Fonts & Portfolio** are the primary two.

Users of Adobe Fonts are significantly more likely to renew their membership (71% vs. 63%) and have $160 higher LTV value. Past campaigns have shown that Fonts awareness marketing is able to lift customer engagement with +0.23pt.

Portfolio is showing a slightly smaller positive uplift in likelihood to renew (71% vs. 67%) and have a $100 impact on LTV for All Apps plan members and $37 for Photography Plan Members. Past campaigns have driven 4.98% uplift in customer engagement and +0.08pt uplift in retention for the photography segment while All Apps surprisingly remained flat.

Within benefits that are exclusive to members, we are also seeing our members value exclusive content – **Photos, Presets, Graphics.** When used as giveaways in campaigns, these types of assets have proven to lift engagement, e.g 5-35% uplift in engagement from offering free presets to our photography audience. Based on this knowledge, several of our engagement & retention campaigns currently use free assets as part of the standard campaign kit. All of them have proven to drive engagement uplift, but none have measured the impact these giveaways have on value perception.

In terms of member exclusives, Fonts & Portfolio are exclusive to members as you cannot access the functionality before you become a member. For free assets, the story is slightly different. These assets are often offered to both prospects (to drive trial downloads) and members, and therefore not marketed as members only. There is one exception – the photography team launched 6 sets of premium presets in June, where most of the presets are only available to members.

There are multiple other possible member exclusives that Adobe has not yet tested performance of but that we believe would/could move the needle. Examples includes partner offers and exclusive access to seminars/portfolio reviews with sought after industry professionals.

In general – to date our focus has been to drive engagement in product vs shift in value perception. Member exclusives have therefore not been set up or communicated as being exclusive to our Creative Cloud members.

**Benefits that only Adobe can provide.**

As part of their membership strategy, several brands that Bond Loyalty group work with, provide unique opportunities for their members. Adidas design special collections that only members of their loyalty program can buy. Mastercard invites their members behind the scenes of Hamilton in their concept “priceless”, Airbnb hosts overnight experiences at Fenway Park, on the Chinese wall and Abbey Road studios.

In 2017 Adobe launched Hidden Treasures of Creativity which follows the same structure of providing a unique experience only Adobe can provide. It is an ongoing series about rediscovering, recreating, and preserving the forgotten tools of old masters, and placing those tools in the hands of a new generation of artists in the digital age. We have digitalized the brushes Edvard Munch used to create the Scream and provided them as Photoshop Brushes. We have completed 5 fonts that the Bauhaus masters were in the process of creating when the school was shut down during the world war. To date, we have released 3 editions of Hidden Treasures and we have seen significant PR value, traffic to our landing pages and price per asset download is below the E&R teams’ current cost per marketing driven product launch. But the campaign has not been exclusive to members and there has not been any measurement as to its ability to lift value perception.

We do however know, that having access to members only opportunities, belonging to an exclusive community, is one of the key differentiators between a subscription that you can turn on and off, and a membership that you value and have emotional belonging and loyalty to.

While marketing member exclusives (and non-exclusives) have proven to drive product engagement uplift, we have not seen positive movement on our quarterly general measurement of CC value perception. It is obvious that we have a dual communication challenge. Just raising awareness and driving adoption of our member exclusives will not be enough – we need to do it in a way thatleaves the member with the feeling that these individual pieces are part of a bigger pledge from Adobe to always reward its members for their loyalty.
overview: This campaign was created to increase value perception of Creative Cloud by raising awareness and driving adoption of Creative Cloud member exclusives. We need to do this in a way that leaves the member with the feeling that these individual pieces are part of a bigger pledge from Adobe to always reward its members for their loyalty.

objective:
Paid Members of Creative Cloud across all individual plan offerings. Professionals, Communicators & Consumers. They do however have common denominators that this campaign is built upon:

5/10 members currently perceive the value of their membership to be lower than the price.

Price is the #1 attrition reason.

Members trust peers first, influencers second and brands third.

To increase value perception (and price elasticity) we have identified 3 value pillars that research show can increase value perception and willingness to retain – Learn & Guidance is the first and most important of those pillars. Members who associate Adobe with Learn & Guidance have a 20pp higher willingness to retain vs. the average members and are more active users. The challenge we are here to solve is that only 11% of our members make the association between Adobe & Learn. We need to increase awareness of our learn offering, and with that drive active use among members.

Learn & Guidance includes tutorials, live sessions, training courses, contextual help as well as building domain knowledge.

Notes from Laura & Terri:

\- Not HT but a Free Resource that is a template made using Illustrator's new 3D tools.

\- E&R use case: Develop social media graphics templates that combine images/graphics

\- Include tips on how to modify template using simplest 3D tools

\- No AR

\- Get Erica Larson's OK on suggested artist (https://www.instagram.com/reel/CaCuX0EM2fN/)

...................

Original pitch: This would be a creator-focused tutorial with designer Quinn Mason (@quinnie.jpg), who specializes in creating branded AR filters on Instagram, on how to make sophisticated 3D selfie frames in Ai.

I was drawn to how she recreated an image of the iconic Ultrafragola mirror (a vintage Sottsass design recently made popular again by fashion influencer selfies) by tracing a product image in Ai, then using the new 3D feature to make it look real. Then, she imported into Meta's Spark AR to turn it into an interactive selfie filter for Instagram.

These sorts of branded selfie filters do REALLY well on IG, and is a marketing tool that Savvy Communicators would want to create themselves. For a Disco story, we would ask Quinn to walk us through this process (but not with an Ultrafragola, which is probably copyrighted).

TL;DR

Creator-focused Ai tutorial. Learn to make a vector by tracing a photo, then give it 3D effects, and (optional) bring it into Spark AR.

Inspired by this post:

https://www.instagram.com/p/CaCuX0EM2fN/

overview:
Paid members who use multiple apps get more value from their membership. These users have higher net promoter scores and retention rates. Many users choose not to learn a new product because of the steep learning curve associated with each of our flagship products. However, we believe that we can inspire users to learn multiple flagships with relevant content that highlights ease of use and creation efficiency between products. We want to promote cross-product workflows between Photoshop and Illustrator, because these are commonly paired products with a large audience opportunity: approximately 500k Ps users do not use Ai.

The goal of this campaign is driving cross-product workflows between Illustrator and Photoshop.

title: Lightroom Mobile Test Phase 1

objective:
The two big mobile learnings we have are:

- Most Desktop users have not tried mobile apps within their entitlement.
- Desktop users often have the assumption that there will be feature parity from desktop to mobile. We are not at feature parity yet, so it’s instead important to highlight the occasions of use, which are 1) Capturing the moment and 2) Using downtime productively
- 85% of Ai SA subscribers have never logged into the Ai on iPad app an 7% have logged on in the past, but not in past 4 weeks

Data

- A/B tests have proven that paid media support is effective in driving mobile app engagement. (FY20 campaign drove +8.88% lift in Rush first use, +7.51% lift in Rush repeat use, and a +6.34% lift in 28-day Rush launch rate.)
- Existing customer cSAT for Ai on iPad is 64%. Not as successful for net new iPad-only customers (cSAT 45%)
- With currently 3.7% penetration of Ai user base, primary focus is bringing added value to the desktop user who wants to work on mobile.

Ai Mobile User Insights:

- Is a CPro (67%) or Aspiring Hobbyists (32%)
- Use Cases: Illustration (70% of iPad vs 28% desktop) and Business Graphics (55% on iPad and desktop)
- Competitive Product Usage: 48% use Procreate (~Ps on iPad usage)
- Skews younger (61% <35 vs 47% <35 desktop), indicating Next Gen Creative

Top Ai on iPad Use Cases

- Drawing Illustrations
- Create Logos/Icons
- Lettering/Type
- Marketing/Ad Content
- Positive feedback for iPad
- Impressed with the shape builder tool.
- Enjoyed saving to the cloud and having access to a laptop.
- Liked the “short tutorials” because they were more efficient than watching a video
- Liked the smoothing feature
- Liked the way fills and gradients worked – being able to drag the points around
- Able to go back and “tinker” with gradients on existing objects
- Found new functions such as masks and mirroring
- iPad app seems easier than desktop

overview:
This is a domain knowledge pitch along the lines of this story: https://creativecloud.adobe.com/cc/discover/article/symmetry-in-photoshop-learn-the-rules-then-break-them

Appeal to savvy communicator: Color can be daunting! We'll take some of the guesswork out of this process by providing savvy communicators with tools and tips on how to create their own color palettes.

Pitch:

We'll help savvy communicators understand how color informs the style and mood of media by showing them an artwork in two colorways, such as: Light/dark or multicolored-colorful/pared down. We'll introduce them to the color wheel and share tips on how to build expanded color palettes with the blend tool, using photographic references, how to save color palettes, and how to quickly recolor artwork to explore new color possibilities.

overview:
https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Pitch-Make-simple-animations-in-Photoshop-with-tweening.--BeMg3RpmLifKavTOzeaR\_0DIAQ-3vxN5WIyj7qXFWHIaK2w8

Use case from ER prioritization spreadsheet: Tween images to create GIFs/animations used in social media

Appeal to savvy communicator: This tutorial should show Savvy Communicators that creating an animation is much easier than they might think. They can use simple animations to enhance photography and make interactive, dynamic social posts with movement.

Pitch: Tween is a function found within the Photoshop Timeline feature that allows you to create simple frame animations by taking a starting frame and end frame and creating the frames in between.

Helpx doc on how to Tween: https://helpx.adobe.com/animate/using/creating\_a\_motion\_tween\_animation.html

This article will be a how-to explaining the production of tweens within Photoshop. Possible iterations on this story include:

1\. Adding illustrated animations to a photograph.

2\. Animating text.

3\. Creating animated graphics.

Scrap: https://www.instagram.com/p/CV\_Ez\_5MCFW/

This is an example of an artist who does very simple animations. They are using the relatively new Fresco function here, but I think it would be instructive to invite them to create a work with the Tween function.

Possible HVAs:

—A giveaway of a PSD file of a completed artwork

—A library of symbols and small drawings to use in your own animated photo post
title: Make simple animations in Photoshop with tweening.
campaign_name: Make simple animations in Photoshop with tweening.

overview:
Today's young designers may not be familiar with Susan Kare or Wim Crouwel, but they're \*VERY\* interested in copping the style they popularized.

This is a single article idea, focused around a current design trend for a pixelated aesthetic, and a general interest in a 1980s/90s revival among Gen Z creators — updated with a contemporary twist.

We would tap a creator for an artist-focused, aspirational look at why pixelated images and lettering are trending again, and the ways they are pairing this look with more sophisticated tools in Ps that are not found in simpler apps like Canva, Procreate, etc.

Ideas on how to frame this:

– use pixelated images as an overlay onto posters and learn why it makes for an interesting composition

– transform specific layers of an illustration

– turn hand-drawn lettering into custom pixelated letterforms

– pixelate an image in Ps, then app hop over to Pr to translate this look into video

Trendspotting:

\- Work with CD to refine HT pitch.

\- Align to one E&R use case.

\- Focus on Savvy Communicator and/or Creative Consumers, not young designers. Pros are not our audience in FY22.

\- Keep it in Ps. Possible follow-up article on combining Ps work with a Pr project.

overview:
Paid members who use multiple apps get more value from their membership. These users have higher net promoter scores and retention rates. Most of our paid members buy the All Apps plan with the understanding that our products work well together and that they will be able to create anything by using products in the Creative Cloud Suite.

Many users choose not to learn a new product because of the steep learning curve associated with each of our flagship products. However, we believe that we can inspire users to learn multiple flagships with relevant content that highlights ease of use and creation efficiency between products. We want to promote cross-product workflows between Photoshop and Illustrator, because these are commonly paired products with a large audience opportunity: approximately 500k Ps users do not use Ai.

The goal of this campaign is driving cross-product workflows between Illustrator and Photoshop.

objective:
We’re targeting graphic designers to encourage and inspire cross-application workflows between Photoshop & Illustrator.

Surveys and research shows that more people appreciate nature now than before the pandemic. Our paid members have been using our products professionally and feel glued to their desk, since the lockdown in March ’20. Moreover, many people struggle with isolation, anxiety, and are looking for distractions or ways to engage with people. In 2021, vaccines are rolling out and people have begun venturing outside. We expect summer seasonality to increase outdoor activities among our paid member base, and drive people to capture memories via photos.

More than 80% of our paid members use product for personal use cases and we expect them to venture out, we want to provide creative opportunities to use both Photoshop and Illustrator in their personal life and outside of their home. Although many of these users are non-beginners, we want the content to not only be inspirational but also accessible to all user skill levels.

Minimal Landscape Portraits

- have experienced a recent resurgence on Google SEO trends;
- can be used for personal or professional use cases;
- in nature, are a relevant fit in terms of summer seasonality and pandemic zeitgeist.
- Illustration Graphics are top use case among Graphic Designers, Illustrators and Artists
overview:
Paid members who use multiple apps get more value from their membership. These users have higher net promoter scores and retention rates. Most of our paid members buy the All Apps plan with the understanding that our products work well together and that they will be able to create anything by using products in the Creative Cloud Suite.

Many users choose not to learn a new product because of the steep learning curve associated with each of our flagship products. However, we believe that we can inspire users to learn multiple flagships with relevant content that highlights ease of use and creation efficiency between products. We want to promote cross-product workflows between Photoshop and Illustrator, because these are commonly paired products with a large audience opportunity: approximately 500k Ps users do not use Ai.

In 2021, we’re seeing a few key design trends that we want to emphasize as we transition out of the pandemic and into the summer: (1) Environment, Nature, and Real-World References and (2) Socially conscious design.

For this campaign, we want to focus on the creation of minimal portraits with an emphasis on Nature. 1-minute tutorials have been highly effective to demonstrate app functionality and value.
title: Ps and Ai Cross App Workflows - Minimal Portraits
campaign_name: Ps and Ai Cross App Workflows - Minimal Portraits

objective:
The two big mobile learnings we have are:

1) Most Desktop users have not tried mobile apps within their entitlement.

2) Desktop users often have the assumption that there will be feature parity from desktop to mobile. It’s instead important to highlight the occasions of use, which are 1) Capturing the moment and 2) Using downtime productively
overview:
Currently 80% of our paid base is not downloading mobile and taking advantage of our mobile offerings. Engagement analysis has demonstrated that users who adopt mobile into their creative and photo editing workflow they are more likely to retain. Running these videos in evergreen paid social would give the opportunity for user to understand that we have relevant mobile offerings already included in their plan.

Evergreen paid social can help us reach users where many are already on their mobile device and where we have the ability to lead them to a destination created specifically for this initiative.

These 3 mobile sizzle reels were created specifically for their associated entitlements showcasing the mobile apps that they are already entitled to.

overview:
Pairing two visually contrasting fonts in a single design has been a continuing trend in brand graphics and poster design. It adds visual interest and can make a simple phrase or word pop — and while it is a very simple technique, it requires some finesse and domain knowledge around fonts to pull it off well. Working with a designer who uses this aesthetic, this would be a tips-oriented story on how to pair two fonts in a design.

Artist:

– could go with 1 designer, do a tips roundup with several (not sure how this would affect contracts for artwork), or develop in-house.

Tips / domain knowledge could include:

– what to look for in font pairings

– visual pacing, when to switch or emphasize one font over another

– playing with scale

– how to lightly customize/alter a letter when needed

Assets could include:

– FontPack of suggested pairings

– poster or social graphics template to get people started
title: Mix and match fonts — in one word!
campaign_name: Mix and match fonts — in one word!

overview:
How to customize a font in Ai

Creator Nazli (@limadeit) shares a lot of tutorials and tips on brand and logo design. In a recent Reel, she shows how to use the Direct Selection tool in Illustrator for a beginner-friendly way to create custom typography using an existing font. We can frame this as an easy How-To, along with tips and a Font Pack of Adobe Font selections recommended by Nazli.

This would naturally include some domain knowledge about working with fonts: what to look for, what details to tweak, and how to customize a font to make it your own.

\*Here's her IG Reel: https://www.instagram.com/reel/CXiwBO9jLcw/

App: Ai

E&R use case:

Beginner-friendly tip for making custom type, which can be used for a logo or other business need

Audience:

Savvy Communicator, Creative Consumer
title: How to customize fonts using Ai's Direct Selection tool
campaign_name: How to customize fonts using Ai's Direct Selection tool

The idea that should come across is that you don't have to be a pro photographer or spend a lot on shoots, with clipping masks, you can focus on a part of an image to highlight your brand or aesthetic in an artistic or engaging way.

title: DVA MAX GA Release Campaign - DE

assets.title: DVA MAX GA Release Campaign - DE 1x1 Thumbnail

campaign_name: DVA MAX GA Release Campaign - DE

objective:
Reach E&R Audiences:

They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential. While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces

They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them

While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)

As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat
How to Reach the E&R Audience:

Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge

If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do


What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
- We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Combine & Organize: Acrobat makes it easy to combine and organize documents from multiple sources into a single PDF for a consolidated document solution that can be easily shared and accessed across surfaces.

Message # 2/ e-Signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Acrobat's Got It - EnR - DIY - PT
campaign_name: Acrobat's Got It - EnR - DIY - PT

overview:
For this chapter of Everyone Can we are trying something new with the traditional Creator Series. Rather than building out a full campaign with a creative pro, we are working with a Savvy Communicator. This will help align and inspire our primary audience of Savvy Communicators with their teacher and realize this is for me. 

We have multiple landing page experiences to understand how the traditional set up with hero landing page/video and full detailed tutorial videos compares to the lighter lift version of the tutorial pages that will include UGC video and a more static tutorial experience. This landing page test within the Display channel will help us understand how the two different landing experiences will perform. CPSAU will be a key indicator if we can still be as effective with this lighter lift experience.

overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

Q4 will be focused on an “Accountant” use case where they need to get an agreement over to their client quickly as they’re ready and available to sign. The TOFU assets bring this use case to life through a relatable, human situation where the Accountant quickly springs into action to get what they need to done for their new client/work, as well as handle what they need to with their anxious puppy.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. As an example, in the Puppy’s Gotta Go story you quickly see the accountant use multiple tools (Webforms; Edit; Request e-signature) to get what’s needed done. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Webforms: Acrobat makes it easy to collect information and apply that data to an existing templated project proposal to make onboarding a new client simple and easy.

Message # 2/ Request e-signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: AGI - EnR - PGG - KO

assets.title: CCI All Apps UPSELL - Animated UNWRP Creator - DE

objective:
Try & Buy – Our goals are to increase awareness for the value of All Apps (savings with 3+ apps), common project uses, and key multi-app workflows for design and video use cases, which will drive trial or purchase of the CCI All Apps plan.

Target paid members with CC single app(s) and photography plan who have been flagged by the Upsell Rank data science model as high propensity to upsell to CCI All Apps (note: cookie IDs and/or emails are used to enable ad targeting)

Primary Audience: Creative Professionals (Workday Creatives and Creative Climbers) who are focused on Design use cases
overview:
GERMAN VERSION
For conversion-focused All Apps Upsell performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the All Apps plan value and key messages to current Creative Cloud Individual subscribers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold, eye-catching, and showcase inspiring uses of multiple apps.

These new Upsell animated UNWRP campaign assets are a creative mashup of content from the FY'22 UNWRP creator campaign and animation style from the FY23 All Apps Explainer video. Studio used an animated style to create these assets to explore whether creator content could be effectively presented through animation rather than our traditional creator narrated style (e.g., would our customers view the animated content as equally compelling, authentic, credible, and relatable?).  The key difference between concepts V1 and V2 is that V2 includes an image and voiceover of the creator (Ashley Fouyelle of UNWRP) whereas V1 is just showing Ashley's workflow and project with background music and image of her.
title: CCI All Apps UPSELL - Animated UNWRP Creator - DE
campaign_name: CCI All Apps UPSELL - Animated UNWRP Creator - DE

overview: Pre-BF promo for Acrobat ACQ
title: Acrobat PreBF Promo - 2023

objective:
Monthly 1+ Launch, Monthly Average Use

E&R Audiences:

They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

How to Reach the E&R Audience:

Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:

We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Combine & Organize: Acrobat makes it easy to combine and organize documents from multiple sources into a single PDF for a consolidated document solution that can be easily shared and accessed across surfaces.

Message # 2/ e-Signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.

objective:
Try & Buy – Our goals are to increase awareness for the value of All Apps (savings with 3+ apps), common project uses, and key multi-app workflows for design and video use cases, which will drive trial or purchase of the CCI All Apps plan.

Target paid members with CC single app(s) and photography plan who have been flagged by the Upsell Rank data science model as high propensity to upsell to CCI All Apps (note: cookie IDs and/or emails are used to enable ad targeting)

Primary Audience: Creative Professionals (Workday Creatives and Creative Climbers) who are focused on Design use cases
overview:
Ashley Fouyolle is a multidisciplinary designer who started a company called UNWRP in her Brooklyn apartment. She uses Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign in cross-app workflows to create luxury gift wrap in unique patterns and vibrant colors. ​

Design use case display and paid social ads for conversion-focused All Apps Upsell performance media channels; we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the All Apps plan value and key messages to current Creative Cloud Individual subscribers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold, eye-catching, and showcase inspiring uses of multiple apps.

These new Upsell animated UNWRP campaign assets are a creative mashup of content from the FY'22 UNWRP creator campaign and animation style from the FY23 All Apps Explainer video. Studio used an animated style to create these assets to explore whether creator content could be effectively presented through animation rather than our traditional creator narrated style (e.g., would our customers view the animated content as equally compelling, authentic, credible, and relatable?).  The key difference between concepts V1 and V2 is that V2 includes an image and voiceover of the creator (Ashley Fouyelle of UNWRP) whereas V1 is just showing Ashley's workflow and project with background music and image of her.
title: FY23 CCI All Apps UPSELL - Animated UNWRP Creator Campaign - NA

overview:
Objective:​
Drive awareness and adoption for the Express entitlement, enhancing value perception​

Strategy:​
- Highlight product updates to communicate added value of 4-month Express entitlement​
- Educate users on the new motion​
- Inspire practical use cases with Acrobat plus Express​

Audience:​
Acrobat 30+ Day tenure​

Main Message:​
Take advantage of your 4-month complimentary access to Express premium features to get even more value from your Acrobat subscription​

Use Cases:​
Resume enhancement or creation – Stylize PDF and Templates​

Channels:​
- Paid Social​
- Display​
- Email​

Measurement: ​
- SAU (M1+, Monthly Average Frequency)
- Cancel ARR​
- Tool Use: Stylize PDF​
- Email: Opens, CTR​
- Media: Engagement, especially CTR

Timing: ​
- Media: Mid-November launch​
- LCM: Mid-November deployment (date TBC)

title: MAX 2023 - Illustrator Release - E&R - FR

assets.title: MAX 2023 - Illustrator Release - E&R - FR 1x1 Thumbnail

objective:
Monthly 1+ Launch, Monthly Average Use

E&R Audiences:

They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

How to Reach the E&R Audience:

Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:

We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

The job of these lower funnel assets is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Combine & Organize: Acrobat makes it easy to combine and organize documents from multiple sources into a single PDF for a consolidated document solution that can be easily shared and accessed across surfaces.

Message # 2/ e-Signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: AGI - EnR - DIY - FR

campaign_name: Acrobat's Got It - Cider - EnR - JP

Premiere Pro Fall/IBC Release - 5x Faster Timelines - CA
campaign_name: Premiere Pro Fall/IBC Release - 5x Faster Timelines - CA

overview:
OBJECTIVE:
Show customers getting their lives organized is easier than they think, and Acrobat has all they need to provide a sense of control and confidence in getting what they need to done. ​

STRATEGY:
- PRIMARY: Showcase how helpful Acrobat is in supporting the end-of-year propensity to get organized and ready for the year to come ​
- SECONDARY: Reinforce product-value and inspire habitual, cross-surface use through value-add PDFs like organizational checklists and goal/habit trackers ​

AUDIENCE:
- Acrobat 30+ Day tenure​

MAIN MESSAGES:
Take advantage of Acrobat’s easy-to-use tools to get your life digitally organized in seconds. It’s easy to scan, combine, and organize a variety of paper documents into one digitized, organized PDF, then access it anywhere – desktop, web, or mobile – so you can start the new year strong. ​

​USE CASES:
- End of Year digital organization​
- Goal/habit tracker​

CHANNELS:
- Paid Social​
- Display​
- Email​

MEASUREMENT:
- SAU (M1+, Monthly Average Frequency), Cancel ARR​
- Toll use: Stylize PDF​
- Email: Opens, CTR​

TIMING:
- December launch in paid media​
- 12/12 tentative deployment start in LCM​

Message # 2/ e-Signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: AGI - EnR - DIY - JP

overview:
LATAM VERSION
For conversion-focused All Apps ACQUISITION performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the All Apps plan value and key messages to current Creative Cloud Individual subscribers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold, eye-catching, and showcase inspiring uses of multiple apps.  
  
  
These new ACQ animated UNWRP campaign assets are a creative mashup of content from the FY'22 UNWRP creator campaign and animation style from the FY23 All Apps Explainer video. Studio used an animated style to create these assets to explore whether creator content could be effectively presented through animation rather than our traditional creator narrated style (e.g., would our customers view the animated content as equally compelling, authentic, credible, and relatable?).  The key difference between concepts V1 and V2 is that V2 includes an image and voiceover of the creator (Ashley Fouyelle of UNWRP) whereas V1 is just showing Ashley's workflow and project with background music and image of her.

title: FY24Q2 Best of Your Shot Your Story - LATAM
campaign_name: FY24Q2 Best of Your Shot Your Story - LATAM

objective:
**E&R Audiences:**

- They’re Acrobat customers but they likely aren’t using the tools to their full potential
- While close to 70% of paid users leverage Desktop per month, only ~12% leverage mobile and ~6% web – big oppt to drive engagement with additional surfaces
- They’re paying because they see the value in Acrobat for their document solutions – but because they’re so time and resource strapped, they likely haven’t taken the time to explore and use all the tools and features that are available to them
  - While they might not be aware of a tool, they might not connect what use case that tool can unlock for them – which is why we want to show (via use) and not tell (via tool explanation)
- As such, they may have a variety of programs they work with to accomplish an end goal that can be achieved with just Acrobat

**How to Reach the E&R Audience:**

- Show them that they already have a complete set of PDF and e-signature tools for any practically document challenge
- If they’re able to use additional tools, they can make their lives much easier, accomplish tasks in way less time, cut down on the number of apps or manual processes they use and eventually get back what every working professional and small business owner truly needs: More time to do the things they want to do

**What we want the E&R Audience to Feel:**

- We want them to experience and feel an “wait, seriously I can do that with Acrobat?” moment
- Provide them with yet another reason to use Acrobat where they might’ve been using another app/tool
- That feeling of surprise and delight and even excitement of when they realize they had something all along and this is going to change the way they work for the good.
  - We’ve also seen that when people realize how much Acrobat can do, they cancel additional subscriptions they’re already paying for (like docusign), which is our end goal
- And ultimately, that they feel like they’re getting the value out of their Acrobat subscription . Most of our cancellers cite it’s too expensive which is code for “Not worth the $” so driving value is essential to make them feel like it’s a valuable investment
overview:
Acrobat’s Got It

A full funnel campaign dedicated to showing working professionals and microbiz audiences how Acrobat can make their work easier and give them the confidence to take on any document challenge – because Acrobat’s got it.

The job of these lower funnel assets for Try/Buy is to bring the audience down the customer journey. To do that, we must focus on the value of a specific tool they saw in the TOF use case and really bring home the value to get the audience into a trial or into the product. Now is our opportunity to reference these tools again and really focus each asset on the benefit of one tool.

Message #1/ Combine & Organize: Acrobat makes it easy to combine and organize documents from multiple sources into a single PDF for a consolidated document solution that can be easily shared and accessed across surfaces.

Message # 2/ e-Signatures: The ability to send out for e-signatures greatly expedites the approval process so they can get started right away. Plus, the client’s experience in receiving a professional-looking proposal, inclusive of all relevant documentation, and having the ability to provide an e-signature creates a strong value perspective for our target company.
title: Copy Acrobat's Got It - EnR - US - DIY Q3
campaign_name: Copy Acrobat's Got It - EnR - US - DIY Q3

objective: Test
overview: This phase is the next iteration of the PS brand campaign. Phase 2 has continued to evolve as a full funnel campaign to further differentiate content across the funnel. E&R content is leading with use-case/output forward content & copy to help the user understand how Ps applies to them. Leading them to the in product Discover Panel to follow along with the tutorial and step-by-step instructions with a practice file. In the tutorial workflow we want our users to understand the fundamentals and how to apply these skillsets to accomplish their goals. This phase focuses around 3 new use cases/workflows; Transform, Combine Images, and Type Frame.
title: Copy Ps Everyone Can Phase 2.0 - Engagement
campaign_name: Copy Ps Everyone Can Phase 2.0 - Engagement

     (total value $10k)

objective:
Try & Buy – Our goals are to increase awareness and showcase the value of All Apps (e.g., The ultimate creative toolkit and savings with 3+ apps) through inspiring cross-app workflows and projects that spark CC members’ imagination and confidence in learning new apps, and motivates them to keep growing their creative skills.  

Target paid members with CC single app(s) and photography plan who have been flagged by the Upsell Rank data science model as high propensity to upsell to CCI All Apps (note: cookie IDs and/or emails are used to enable ad targeting)

Primary Audience: Creative Professionals (Workday Creatives and Creative Climbers) who are focused on Design use cases
overview:
For conversion-focused CCI All Apps Upsell performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the value of All Apps as a premium plan and key messages to current Creative Cloud Individual subscribers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold and colorful, relatable creator-led content showcasing cross-app workflows and inspiring projects. 

These Sarah Arnett campaign assets were created by Studio in FY24 and showcase her using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop to create a large-scale piece of art and apply it to a silk robe, furniture upholstery, and plate ware, then using Premiere Pro to share it through social media video. Sarah is a decorative designer who applies her bold, colorful, "More is More" style to clothing, home interiors and furnishings. She grew up in Zimbabwe, moved to India before returning to Brighton, UK to start her design business. She started learning Adobe apps at 35 years old, starting with Illustrator and Photoshop, adding InDesign and Acrobat, and more recently learning video in Premier Pro.

objective:
EMEA version
Try & Buy – Our goals are to increase awareness and showcase the value of All Apps (e.g., The ultimate creative toolkit and savings with 3+ apps) through inspiring cross-app workflows and projects that spark CC members’ imagination and confidence in learning new apps, and motivates them to keep growing their creative skills.  

Target paid members with CC single app(s) and photography plan who have been flagged by the Upsell Rank data science model as high propensity to upsell to CCI All Apps (note: cookie IDs and/or emails are used to enable ad targeting)

Primary Audience: Creative Professionals (Workday Creatives and Creative Climbers) who are focused on Design use cases
overview:
EMEA version
For conversion-focused Add-On of Creative Cloud performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the value of adding on additional products. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold and colorful, relatable creator-led content showcasing cross-app workflows and inspiring projects. 

These Sarah Arnett campaign assets were created by Studio in FY24 and showcase her using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop to create a large-scale piece of art and apply it to a silk robe, furniture upholstery, and plate ware, then using Premiere Pro to share it through social media video. Sarah is a decorative designer who applies her bold, colorful, "More is More" style to clothing, home interiors and furnishings. She grew up in Zimbabwe, moved to India before returning to Brighton, UK to start her design business. She started learning Adobe apps at 35 years old, starting with Illustrator and Photoshop, adding InDesign and Acrobat, and more recently learning video in Premier Pro.

objective:
Try & Buy – Our goals are to increase awareness and showcase the value of All Apps (e.g., The ultimate creative toolkit and savings with 3+ apps) through inspiring cross-app workflows and projects that spark CC members’ imagination and confidence in learning new apps, and motivates them to keep growing their creative skills.  

Primary Audience: Creative Professionals (Workday Creatives and Creative Climbers) who are focused on Design use cases
overview:
For conversion-focused CCI All Apps Acquisition performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the value of All Apps as a premium plan and key messages to prospective Creative Cloud Individual customers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold and colorful, relatable creator-led content showcasing cross-app workflows and inspiring projects.

These Michael Lim campaign assets were created by Studio in FY24 and showcase his use of Adobe Photoshop and Premiere Pro to create 2D animations. He starts with hand drawn illustrations, animates them frame by frame in Photoshop, and then adds color grading and effects in Premiere Pro. He favorite tools are Gaussian Blur and Lumeteri color. Michael lives in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and takes inspiration from the street life and city lights. His Space Dawg Studio reflects his retro aesthetic style and interest in symmetry, and color.

For conversion-focused CCI All Apps Upsell to All Apps performance media channels, we are developing branded assets with animated images (GIF) and video assets that reinforce the value of All Apps as a premium plan and key messages to current Creative Cloud Individual subscribers. The creative reflects insights from recent CCI All Apps research and best practices implemented from previous upsell campaign performance results -- e.g., visually bold and colorful, relatable creator-led content showcasing cross-app workflows and inspiring projects.

These Michael Lim campaign assets were created by Studio in FY24 and showcase his use of Adobe Photoshop and Premiere Pro to create 2D animations. He starts with hand drawn illustrations, animates them frame by frame in Photoshop, and then adds color grading and effects in Premiere Pro. He favorite tools are Gaussian Blur and Lumeteri color. Michael lives in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and takes inspiration from the street life and city lights. His Space Dawg Studio reflects his retro aesthetic style and interest in symmetry, and color.
